runs.comm: charges out first ball to an away swinging full toss, and thick edges it, couple of bounces, to the slip cordon, two men there
away to third man for the first run of the game
right on the mark with a pitched-up ball angled into off, blocked
bounce, lots of it, as he gets it to straighten from a good length outside off, Fulton pushing out from the crease, beaten
pitched up, and Fulton gets it away, moving forward and easing it between cover and extra cover
quick and straight on off stump, fullish length, blocked solidly
swift, full and angling down the leg side first up
away shape, a bit of it, angles in good length on off, and swerves away late, pushed with an open face to covers
into the pads this time, pitched-up lengths from South Africa so far, clipped away over square leg
now it moves away, Nicol charging out, and having a heave, but the swing produces a thick edge to third man
hit on the pad with a 135.5 kph good length delivery that he fails to work to leg
he is getting just enough away movement to trouble the batsmen, he pushes away from the body, in the air, but far short of the diving backward point, the captain
firm push to a length ball, misfield at extra cover but mid off is around to prevent the single
and Kleinveldt strikes first ball, Nicol looking to step out and have a go for the third time, and Kleinveldt's bounce off a good length defeats him, de Kock snaps up the edge
bouncer first up to the New Zealand captain, who ducks
right forward, big stride, and pushes to cover
blasted, slight, only sllight width available, and McCullum cracks a powerful cut between cover and backward point
lunges forward, manages to nudge a bouncing length ball to the leg side
lift from back of a length, played out softly towards cover
Fulton was halfway up the crease but made it back in time, Steyn straying on the pads again but McCullum could not put it past short fine
now he does, Steyn fuller on the pads, no swing, and McCullum whips him away to deep square
shot, Steyn digs it in back of a length, tall Fulton gets it at waist height and pulls it behind square leg quite comfortably
length ball, bit of away movement, pushed to covers
stays beside the line and plays out a length ball on off towards point
oh well, pitched up, swung, tamely and straight to mid on, who was placed a touch shortish
a huge forward stride again from McCullum as he pushes to covers
pitched up to off stump, defended down the pitch
on middle now, back of a length, defended
tight line this, off stump, short of a good length, can't do much with it

got the big one, a few tight deliveries was all it needed, short of a length once again from Kleinveldt, into the pads, McCullum swivels and swipes hard at it, top edge cannot evade the backpedalling short fine leg
bouncer first up to Franklin as well, after McCullum got one, off stump line, avoided easily
slanting across the left-hander, left alone
another one going across him, he decides to pull it, cannot connect
not a bad way to score your first international runs, down the track, takes on a back of a length ball and swings it to the deep square leg rope
back to swinging and missing outside off stump
wanders out after chopping a shortish one, backward point advances, and he has to rush back, throw misses
alternating between boundaries and misses, shortish once more, width, and he swats it through midwicket
defends a good length ball back to the bowler

another one goes, short of a length ball, attempted hook edged through to the wicketkeeper, replays show it came off the shoulder, could have brushed the glove, Franklin had a look at his shoulder before departing
neat punch off the back foot, but a neat diving stop at cover by Behardien, threw himself at the ball
phew, that flew, dug in short and reared across the left-hander, leaving him hopping and beaten
widish, and he gets hold of it, swats it off the back foot flat over covers
nudges a back of a length ball close to the pitch on the leg side and goes for the single
forward to a good length ball and eases it to covers

oh boy, coming apart for New Zealand now, standing in the crease and swatting a bouncing good length delivery straight to mid off, Morris gets his first international wicket, ball hit the bat close to the top
zippy good length delivery angles down the leg side
forward to a full delivery and pushes it to the bowler
that kind of a day for New Zealand, short and wide ball, and almost cut to the third man fielder, to him on the bounce
length ball defended to the leg side, bowler fields
thick inside edges the first ball from a spinner, which carries straight on, to square leg
slower, fuller and straightening on middle, defended
makes him drive, straight back to the bowler
opening up, but it is angled in and he can only block
this angled in even more, quite harmlessly and slowly it appeared at first, but Nathan backed away and went for the pull, missed, and was bowled, sigh, in his defence, the ball kept a tad low
fullish one worked to midwicket
they keep trying the pull, the ball is not exactly short, good length it is, but he manages to swipe it through midwicket
tight defence, length ball right on off, gets forward and blocks it
super stroke, short ball at his throat, he swivels and hooks it along the ground to the deep backward square leg rope
slower one pitched up, nudged to fine leg
third four of the over, slower short ball now, he waits and pulls it past square leg, and beats the man in the deep too
way down the pads, and worked away to fine leg
makes room and cuts it from off stump wide of third man
gets to the pitch of a tossed up ball and drives to long off
angled across the left-hander, dabbed to short third, not getting the single
chopped on, one of the last things New Zealand needed, made room for the cut, wasn't enough of it in the end, stays a touch low too, and he loses a bail
flighted as generously as I have ever seen him flight it, very full and patted back to the bowler
defended off the front foot
pitched up and angled across the left-hander, driven away from the body, to extra cover
short, wide and going away with the angle, cut-and-a-miss
they continue to go for their strokes, charges out, and smashes a length ball high over extra cover, almost went all the way
very full, nearly in the blockhole, inside-edged into the pads, they take on the point fielder with a sharp single
short of a length, into the pads, and worked to fine leg
sigh^infinity, they refuse to learn, opens up and swings at a slowish good length ball, vertical top edge comes down to the bowler
flighted full, dips on him, squeezed out to the off side
length ball coming slowly off the pitch on middle and off, whipped square to leg
lunges forward at a flighted one, which dips again, and he has to just push it away in the end
played quietly from the crease
beats the outside edge now with one that goes across the left-hander
length ball on middle played out to the leg side
tries to swat a short ball away, misses and is hit on the stomach
gets on top of another short ball and pulls it into the ground, away to deep square
opens the face and steers a back of a length ball to third man
pushed to cover
full and right on middle and off, blocked
chases a wide delivery outside off and misses
opens the face to run a short of a length ball to point
guides it neatly past backward point, comes back for the second as third man gets to the ball
banged in short from round the stumps, avoided
coming in with the angle into the left-hander, nudged to the leg side, bowler fields and prevents the single
no room with the changed angle, has to block the length ball
stays in the crease and runs a pitched up ball to point
weaves away and manages to steer a length ball to the third man rope, which is vacant
clears mid off, and flies to the boundary, got under the full delivery and drilled it just out of reach of a leaping Steyn
three in three, reaches out to a length ball and half-runs it, half-thick-edges it past the lone slip, third man is in place now, but he is not getting there
short., too short, and he misses
bowler falls after delivering a good length ball, which is nudged towards mid on
angles in and hits the pad on the forward push, appeal turned down, , replays show it hitting top of leg
another shout for lbw, this one looked closer, not given again
steps out and pushes back to the bowler
pushed to the off side
slog swept from outside off, on the bounce to deep midwicket
punched from the crease, in the air for quite some time, down to long off
pitched up, he gets fron leg away and smashes it, straight to wide mid off
goes for the yorker, down the pads, nudged fine down leg
chance, Davids comes screaming in from long on, Bracewell had hit a slow length ball in the air, Davids dives forward, but the ball has bounced in front by then
drills a very full one wide of sweeper cover for two more
short of a length wide outside off, chops it into the pitch
widish length ball, he runs it to point
low full toss hit into the ground and bounces to cover for a 'crowd catch'
this is a proper catch now, and the last NZ wicket falls to a botched pull off a good length delivery as well, straight to midwicket
